page.title: 15LOCAL LEGENDS IN EDGEFIELD
page.content: This used to be a smuggling area, being only a few miles from the coast. Legend has it that the Rector was on the side of the smugglers, and 'brandy for the parson' was left in hollow stones in the Rectory gateposts. The old White Horse Inn still stands although it is no longer an inn. We are told that there was an underground passage from there to the coast at Cley and that if you put your ear to the ground you may hear the smugglers singing. It was however noticeable that those coming out of the inn heard the sound more clearly than those going in.
